alert.note: Alert for Boone; Dallas; Jasper; Polk; Story; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 1:02AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Polk, southwestern Story, west central Jasper, southeastern Boone, northeastern Dallas and north central Warren Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 101 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Des Moines, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, West Des Moines, Ankeny, Urbandale, Johnston, Clive, Altoona, Waukee, Norwalk, Pleasant Hill, Grimes, Windsor Heights, Carlisle, Bondurant, Polk City, Huxley, Saylorville, Madrid, Mitchellville and Colfax. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 70 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 102. Interstate 80 between mile markers 120 and 155. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Dallas; Jasper; Polk; Story; Warren
